basics.name: Daniel William Clarke
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary:
*I enjoy building software as I see both the art and science that it requires. I find it very enjoyable to see how a particular project or problem captivates me.*

I am an engaged and quality focused full stack software engineer.

I am always seeking to grasp bleeding edge technologies and practices in cloud, micro service architecture. software development, cyber security, CI/CD, SOLID and TDD.

I am currently leading a team of 5 software engineers, though I never thought that leadership would be something I would venture into, I am enjoying the challenge, and looking forward to the opportunities this role may yield!

work.summary: 14 month internship with Schlumberger. Where my main role was to continue the ongoing development of a simulation and software integration test platform for both prototype research algorithms and models and commercial Schlumberger products.

As part of an international team, spread between Gatwick UK, Faroe Islands, Pune, and Houston. I was a software engineer / architect developing the latest iteration of an Oil and Gas industry cloud based upstream learning simulator, OilSim.

Working within a Cloud Infrastructure Team for Seismic / Subsurface Exploration Oil and Gas projects. Using a polyglot technology stack to build solutions for critical work streams that included; building and maintaining micro services to bridge the gap between next gen and legacy platforms, as well as building infrastructure providing our clients access to powerful seismic interpretation machine learning.

work.position: Full Stack Software Engineer: GAIA Core
work.summary: Full stack software engineer leading a team of 4 software engineers for the GAIA Data discovery and marketplace platform.

education.summary: BSc (Hons) Computer Science BCS accredited course, I achieved the second highest grade of my cohort  in my final year, graduating with a First
Studied a range of A-Level subjects gaining access to study at university

skills.summary:
I have worked with and are proficient with a large variety of programming languages, frameworks and tools. For backend web applications I use Golang and Nodejs. For frontend; TypeScript and JavaScript, and for performant apps, services and games I use C++. I feel most at home with C++ and Golang, but I am trying to learn a few *esoteric* languages such as Rust and Assembly.

Below is a selection of the languages, frameworks and tools I have had experience with during my career so far.

interests.summary: Outside of my professional work, I enjoy spending my time doing any of the following:
list: My partner and I have recently had our first child, so being the **best dad I can be** is my foremost interest
I love to play **Magic the Gathering** and **Elite Dangerous**
**Developing** my own indie games in my spare time
Learning how simple **mathematics** can lead to captivating 2D/3D visualisations
**Cooking** new and interesting meals for my Family and I

projects.name: Untitled Indie Space Shooter
projects.summary: Ongoing indie space shooter project I am building in my spare time using C++ and SFML, Based on my first year university programming class project submission.

projects.name: My Portfolio
projects.summary: I have made this Portfolio's code available for all to see!

projects.name: Semi Autonomous Finite State Machines
projects.summary: To complete my final year at Nottingham Trent University, I researched and developed an application capable of the generation and deployment of semi-autonomous supervisory controllers for process automation. Upon completion I was then able return to Schlumberger Gould Research to demonstrate and integrate my solution with their drilling simulation test platform and autonomously drove a physical miniature drilling rig live.

projects.name: Predator/Prey Simulation
projects.summary: A predator / prey simulation with AI. I have currently began to resurrect the code base from ages long passed

projects.name: Past Digital Art Works 2006 - 2010
projects.summary: In my youth I was a budding digital artist, All of my works are available to view on DeviantArt!
